input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ALLIER DEPARTMENT. Summary: Professional and Socio-Professional Support Services for Rsa Recipients from the Department of Allier - Booster. Description: In a difficult economic context where companies are having difficulty recruiting staff to ensure their activities and in accordance with the law for full employment of December 18, 2023 aiming for a strong reduction in the unemployment rate, the Allier department wishes to strengthen support for RSA recipients and expand the toolbox of integration professionals within the Employment Integration Spaces in charge. The purpose of this consultation is to select a holder or holders responsible for summoning and accompanying any RSA recipient falling within the framework of this consultation towards a pre-employment return to activity path through to company integration and continued activity (lots no. 1 to 3). The last batch (n4) aims to provide socio-professional support for job seekers under the reference of support Employment Integration Spaces or the provision of services on behalf of France Travail. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Technical Monitoring of Automatic Sprinkler-Type Water Extinguishing Installations at the Lyon Perrache Exchange Center - Lyon 2Nd. Description: The Lyon-Perrache Exchange Center is a 1st category establishment open to the public. As such, it is subject to strict regulations, particularly in the area of ​​safety equipment against the risks of fire and panic. Since its construction, it has been equipped with an installation sprinkler, which schematically comprises 2 sources and 7 stations (4 stations under glycol and 3 stations under water) to supply approximately 3,304 sprinkler heads. Technical monitoring covers the following services: - Half-yearly, annual and three-yearly regulatory checks - Curative maintenance (on-call, troubleshooting and installation improvement operations). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GIP ATLANPOLE (44). Summary: Intellectual Services for Carrying out Experimental Proofs Based on Artificial Intelligence in Pays De La Loire (Edih Diva). Description: Framework agreement for subsequent contracts relating to the selection of 10 ESN service providers who will support Loire companies in carrying out experimental proofs based on Artificial Intelligence (POC IA DIVA) for a total amount of EUR 1,026,000 including tax. The maximum amount of each POC IA DIVA service is 38,000 EUR including tax. The production of experimental proofs (POC IA DIVA) is the subject of an operation co-financed by the European Regional Development Fund (FEDER 21-27). This framework agreement is multi-awarded in application of article R.2162-11 of the code of public procurement. The maximum number of beneficiaries of the Framework Agreement is limited to 10 (ten) service providers, subject to having received a sufficient number of offers which will be put back into competition pursuant to article R2162-10 of the CCP. It is executed by the conclusion of subsequent contracts in application of articles R.2162-2, R.2162-7 et seq. of the CCP.. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Intellectual Services for Carrying out Experimental Proofs Based on Artificial Intelligence in Pays De La Loire (Edih Diva)

The production of experimental proofs (POC IA DIVA) is the subject of an operation co-financed by the European Regional Development Fund (FEDER 21-27). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF NIMES. Summary: Production of the Municipal Newspaper Vivre Nimes. Description: Vivre Nimes is the information magazine intended for the entire population of Nimes and produced by the Information-Editorial department of the Communication Department of the City of Nimes. It is published monthly, except in August (i.e. 11 issues per year). Each number is currently drawn on recycled paper in 84,000 copies: - 79,572 copies are distributed at the start of the month to the mailboxes of all individuals and businesses in the town; - Qualified distribution is also implemented internally in the form of drop-off points: 4428 copies are deposited at drop-off points. That's a total volume of around 924,000 copies per year.<br> The services, subject of the consultation, are divided into separate lots as follows: - Lot 1: Layout of the municipal newspaper "Vivre Nimes"; - Lot 2: Printing, shaping, packaging and delivery of the municipal newspaper "Vivre Nimes". The services will be remunerated by applying unit prices to the quantities actually executed/delivered.<br> As part of this consultation, the City of Nimes acts as the contracting authority.<br> The services are the subject of a framework agreement giving rise to the issuance of purchase orders, placed in application of articles L2125-1-1, R2162-1 to R2162-6, R2162-13 and R2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CP DAIRY UNION. Summary: Information and Communication Campaign in Favor of the "Beurre Charentes-Poitou Aop" Industry 2027-2029. Description: This contract concerns the design and implementation of a global communication and information program aimed at promoting the "Charentes-Poitou AOP butter" quality label. This program will be deployed in France and Belgium over the period 2027-2029.<br> The Charentes-Poitou butter industry AOP wishes to strengthen the notoriety and consideration of its label among a specific professional target: active artisan bakers and pastry chefs, for whom the use of Charentes-Poitou AOP butter constitutes an asset facilitating their work and enhancing their creations.<br> This action is part of the French and Belgian markets, with an educational approach to explain the characteristics, advantages and added value of the Charentes-Poitou AOP butter quality label.<br> The incumbent will be responsible for designing the program, defining its messages, supports and the distribution channels, then ensure their operational implementation.<br> It is specified that the evaluation of the results as well as the impact of the program are not part of this market, and will be entrusted to a third party company.<br> INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION CAMPAIGN IN FAVOR OF THE "BUTTER" INDUSTRY CHARENTES-POITOU AOP "2027-2029<br> This contract concerns the design and implementation of a global communications program and information aimed at promoting the "Charentes-Poitou AOP butter" quality label. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CP DAIRY UNION. Summary: Information and Communication Campaign in Favor of the "Beurre Charentes-Poitou Aop" Industry 2027-2029. Description: This contract concerns the design and implementation of a global communication and information program aimed at promoting the "Charentes-Poitou AOP butter" quality label. This program will be deployed in France and Belgium over the period 2027-2029. The Charentes-Poitou butter industry AOP wishes to strengthen the notoriety and consideration of its label among a specific professional target: active artisan bakers and pastry chefs, for whom the use of Charentes-Poitou AOP butter constitutes an asset facilitating their work and enhancing their creations. This action takes place on the French and Belgian markets, with an educational approach to explain the characteristics, advantages and added value of the Charentes-Poitou AOP butter quality label. The incumbent will be responsible for designing the program, defining the messages, the supports and distribution channels, then ensure their operational implementation. It is specified that the evaluation of the results as well as the impact of the program are not part of this market, and will be entrusted to a company third party.. Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Information and Communication Campaign in Favor of the "Beurre Charentes-Poitou Aop" Industry 2027-2029
output.Description: This contract concerns the design and implementation of a global communication and information program aimed at promoting the "Charentes-Poitou AOP butter" quality label. This program will be deployed in France and Belgium over the period 2027-2029. The Charentes-Poitou butter industry AOP wishes to strengthen the notoriety and consideration of its label among a specific professional target: active artisan bakers and pastry chefs, for whom the use of Charentes-Poitou AOP butter constitutes an asset facilitating their work and enhancing their creations. This action takes place on the French and Belgian markets, with an educational approach to explain the characteristics, advantages and added value of the Charentes-Poitou AOP butter quality label. The incumbent will be responsible for designing the program, defining the messages, the supports and distribution channels, then ensure their operational implementation. It is specified that the evaluation of the results as well as the impact of the program are not part of this market, and will be entrusted to a company third party.
output.Sub_Sector: Legal, Marketing, Consulting and Recruitment Services

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CHU SUD REUNION. Summary: Maintenance of Emergency Electrogenerators for the Annual Needs of the Chu Nord Chfg and the Gher. Description: In accordance with the provisions of articles L.1111 1 and L.1111 5 of the Public Procurement Code, this framework agreement is a service contract aimed at the preventive, corrective and palliative maintenance of emergency generator power plants (CGE) including two power plants (CGE1 in LV and CGE2 in HT) as well as a mobile group, equipment essential to the operation of the University Hospital Center - Site Nord Felix Guyon (CHFG). This is a framework agreement requiring results, with 24-hour on-call duty and requirement for continuity of service. The services include specifically on: - Maintenance of the CGE1 power plant, equipped with CATERPILLAR brand generators. - Maintenance of the CGE2 power plant, equipped with SDMO brand generators. - The maintenance of a mobile SDMO group, intended to strengthen the resilience of the system in the event of occasional need or failure of a fixed power plant. This is a single-award public service contract awarded in the form of a framework agreement with a maximum annual purchase following article R.2162-4-2 of the Public Procurement Code which amounts to: 350,000.00 euro(s) excluding VAT per year (i.e. 1 400,000.0 euro(s) excluding tax for the total duration of the contract of 48 months). Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF ALES. Summary: Maintenance and Upkeep of Fountains in the City of Ales. Description: This contract is concluded for an initial period of one year from its date of notification and is expressly renewable twice. The duration of each renewal period is 1 year. The maximum duration of the contract, all periods combined, is 3 years. Market financing: funds owned by the City of Ales. Payment by bank transfer within 30 days. Application of default interest (BCE increased by 8 points) and fixed compensation for recovery costs of 40 euro(s). Price variation: revised annually in the event of renewal. The groups joint or several companies are admitted. The agent must be duly designated in the application letter or in the DUME and cannot represent in this capacity more than one group for the same contract. In the event of a joint grouping, the common representative of the joint grouping will be jointly with each of the members of the group for their contractual obligations towards the public entity for the execution of this contract. Applicants are prohibited from submitting multiple offers while acting both as individual applicants and as members of one or more groups or as members of several groups. No variations accepted. Award criteria: The most economically advantageous offer assessed according to the criteria set out in the specifications (Regulations of the Consultation).. Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-11-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL OF VAL-D'OISE. Summary: Contract N2025ao071940 - Preventive and Scalable Maintenance of the Toip Architecture which Supports Fixed Telephony on all Cdvo Administrative Sites and the Deployment of Telephony on I. Description: The purpose of this contract is the maintenance of the IP telephony and unified communications architecture, the supply of telephony hardware and software, unified communications, TOIP deployment services and its operation within the Val d'Oise Departmental Council, as well as the possible extension of the current centralized architecture, the addition of services around the existing solution. The ToIP deployment services on departmental sites will be marginal given that all administrative sites known to date are equipped with TOIP. If the Department decides to deploy an Alcatel TOIP architecture for colleges, it will then be necessary to deploy this technology in the 112 colleges, possibly creating a centralized architecture in a Department datacenter. Note that a certain number of colleges already have TOIP but with a Centrex type solution. As part of a migration of these colleges to a centralized TOIP architecture, compatible with the Department's TOIP solution, the use of SIP stations already in place in the colleges will be requested. This contract is concluded for a firm duration 4 years from the date of notification. It is concluded without a minimum overall amount and with a maximum overall amount of 1,000,000 euro(s) excluding tax.. Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Contract N2025ao071940 - Preventive and Scalable Maintenance of the Toip Architecture which Supports Fixed Telephony on all Cdvo Administrative Sites and the Deployment of Telephony on I
output.Description: The purpose of this contract is the maintenance of the IP telephony and unified communications architecture, the supply of telephony hardware and software, unified communications, TOIP deployment services and its operation within the Val d'Oise Departmental Council, as well as the possible extension of the current centralized architecture, the addition of services around the existing solution. The ToIP deployment services on departmental sites will be marginal given that all administrative sites known to date are equipped with TOIP. If the Department decides to deploy an Alcatel TOIP architecture for colleges, it will then be necessary to deploy this technology in the 112 colleges, possibly creating a centralized architecture in a Department datacenter. Note that a certain number of colleges already have TOIP but with a Centrex type solution. As part of a migration of these colleges to a centralized TOIP architecture, compatible with the Department's TOIP solution, the use of SIP stations already in place in the colleges will be requested. This contract is concluded for a firm duration 4 years from the date of notification. It is concluded without a minimum overall amount and with a maximum overall amount of 1,000,000 euro(s) excluding tax.

The SPL SPIIT could, in the future, during the procurement procedure and/or during the execution of this framework agreement, be entrusted with the railway rolling stock of other Regions, if necessary, for the same objectives as those described in the framework agreement. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CHOLET AGGLOMERATION. Summary: Maintenance and Checks of Generating Sets (2026-2029) - Group of Orders. Description: The services consist of carrying out periodic checks (monthly or annual), checks (monthly or annual) and maintenance of the generators in the buildings of the members of the group, according to the informative and non-exhaustive list in the appendix, from 2026 to 2029. The equipment to be maintain, their characteristics and their location are mentioned in the informative and non-exhaustive list of installations to check. The details of the services to be carried out are specified in article 8 of the Specifications of Contractual Clauses. The framework agreement with purchase orders is made for a period going from notification and at the earliest from January 1, 2026 to December 31, 2026, renewable 3 times by express renewal per period of one year, i.e. at the latest until December 31, 2029. In accordance with article R.2162-2 of the Public Order Code, the consultation will give rise to a framework agreement with purchase orders, without minimum, with maximum, as follows: Maximum annual amounts: City: 10,000.00 euro(s) excluding tax, i.e. 12,000.00 euro(s) including tax CA: 15,000.00 euro(s) excluding tax, i.e. 18,000.00 euro(s) including tax CIAS: 15,000.00 euro(s) excluding tax, i.e. 16,500.00 euro(s) including tax This framework agreement is managed in euro(s) excluding VAT, knowing that VAT for services relating to the CIAS is reduced to 10%. The prices in the Unit Price Schedule are applied to the quantities actually executed.. Published Date: 2025-11-01. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: This contract includes the realization of the commercial component of the DOO and the DAACL and their updating until the approval of the SCoT. This mission consists of: • The realization of the commercial component of the DOO and the DAACL which meets the requirements of the Urban Planning Code, integrating the commercial components, crafts and logistics (small logistics). This will involve drafting the document, formulating requirements and recommendations in terms of commercial development and spatializing the commercial zones (urban centralities and peripheral areas of location). • Assistance from the Union in the drafting of the constitutive documents of the SCoT on the trade, craft and logistics aspects: the DAACL aims to co-construct and specify the DOO while being part of the diagnostic issues and the orientations of the PAS; • Facilitating consultation times with stakeholders at key stages of the procedure; • Support for elected officials in decision-making assistance. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AIX-EN-PROVENCE TOWN HALL. Summary: Framework Agreement for Catering Services - 2 Lots. Description: The purpose of this contract is to provide catering services for receptions, cocktails and various events organized by the City of Aix-en-Provence. It is made up of two lots (detailed services in the CCTP of each lot): Lot 1: High-end catering services with service. Batch 2: Classic catering services with or without service. This is a framework agreement with single-award purchase orders, concluded at a unit price and subject to quarterly review. It is concluded for a period of one year from February 1, 2026 or its date of notification if this is later. The number of renewal periods is set at 2. The duration of each period is 1 year. The maximum duration of the contract for all periods combined is 3 years. An advance is planned for both lots. A delivery of samples is planned, in accordance with article 5.2 of the Consultation Regulations (RC). Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF CARCASSONNE. Summary: Image Capturing, Film-Making, Reporting and Video Animation Services. Description: The Municipality of Carcassonne wishes to entrust a service provider with the production of films, reports and video animations.<br> The service provider must master the capture of images using several cameras while broadcasting them in real time using the devices present in particular at the Center of Congress, at the Carcassonne Festival, at the Odeum and in the Municipal Council room. Films from this recording may be requested.<br> The consultation will result in the conclusion of a framework agreement with a single economic operator for a period of 4 years from March 1, 2026 with a minimum amount and a maximum amount expressed in euros excluding tax.<br> IMAGE CAPTURING, FILM-MAKING, REPORTING AND VIDEO ANIMATION SERVICES<br> The total amount of services for the duration of the framework agreement, i.e. 4 years, is between a minimum of €60,000 excluding tax and a maximum of €600,000 H.T.<br> The Holder will receive an order form for each service specifying the dates as well as a description of the expected service in accordance with the services defined in the BPU.<br> The holder will be able to provide 2 to 3 people and will sometimes have to carry out tests on site.<br> He will be able to be required to broadcast live (streaming), and/or on the big screen of the Convention Center.<br> Doc Title: IMAGE CAPTURE, FILM-MAKING, REPORTING AND VIDEO ANIMATION SERVICES<br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 600000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: LAMBALLE LAND & SEA AGGLOMERATION. Summary: Opportunity Study on the Future of the Lamballe National Stud Site. Description: This consultation concerns a contract for intellectual services relating to an opportunity study on the future of the Haras national de Lamballe site. The services are divided into 3 phases defined as follows: - Phase 1: Diagnosis - Phase 2: Development of scenarios - Phase 3 : Development of a roadmap. The cumulative time taken to complete the phases of the study may not exceed 13 months. The estimated execution times for each phase of the service are as follows: - Diagnosis: 5 months - Development of scenarios: 6 months - Development of a sheet travel time: 2 months. However, the candidate may propose in the Act of Commitment a provisional timetable for distributing the duration of each phase, while respecting the overall deadline of 13 months maximum. The execution of each phase begins from the date set by the service order prescribing to begin benefits.. Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Advisory and Assistance Mission to Project Management for the Award of Management Contracts by Property Managers. Description: The purpose of the public contract is as follows: Mission of advice and assistance to project management for the award of contracts for the management of property managers. FORM OF THE PUBLIC PROCUREMENT: This is a global and fixed price contract in application of article R2112-6-2 of the Code of public order, concerning phases 1, 2, 3 and 4. A share of the market is planned at unit prices in application of article R2112-6-1 of the public order code. This is the following service: additional meetings at the request of the EPFIF. The unit price part will be executed by issuing purchase orders in application of articles R2162-13 and 14 of the public procurement code. There is no minimum amount. The maximum amount of services at unit price is 10,000 Euros excluding tax for the entire duration of the contract (15 months). The planned public market consists of phases following: - Phase 1: Initial diagnosis / inventory, - Phase 2: Proposal for target organization and action plan, - Phase 3: Drafting of market documents and support for the consultation procedure, - Phase 4: Assistance with the transition between old and new service providers. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF ORLEANS. Summary: Service Concession for the Development and Operation of Halles Chatelet in Orleans (45). Description: The purpose of this consultation, launched by the City of Orleans by concession contract, is to entrust the future concessionaire with the development and operation of the Halles Chatelet d'Orleans as well as the operation of the Halles de Transitions during the work period, and thus transfer a risk linked to the operation of the delegated service. His remuneration will come for a substantial part from the operating revenues of the activities for which he will be responsible but also - where applicable - from financial contributions which will be paid to him by the Granting Authority and which will be defined within the draft contract. The service concession is of a mixed type bringing together, on the one hand, activities relating to a public service (gourmet halls) (public service concession) and, on the other hand, activities which cannot be qualified as a public service (accessory activities restoration type). However, the geographical overlap and the need for overall coherence of the different activities developed in the draft contract requires the use of a single contract. The concessionaire will be entirely responsible for the execution of its missions, both with regard to of Orleans as well as users and third parties. The concessionaire will assume the operation of the works at its own expense and risk. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY OF AIX-MARSEILLE. Summary: Rejuvenation Service for the Eremap Brand Magnetron Cathode Sputtering System. Description: This contract consists of renovating a sputtering frame for the deposition of thin layers under vacuum by magnetron cathode sputtering purchased by Aix-Marseille University in 2003. The equipment is composed of a chamber and its chassis as well as a control tower. All the power part, control and supervision is located in the control tower. The cooling range and all the sub-assemblies (deposit, pressure control, pumping, etc.) are integrated into the chassis chamber assembly. The primary pumps are independent. The chamber is equipped with 3 confocal sources and allows you to make co-deposits using these sources simultaneously. In addition, the rotation of the substrate holder ensures good homogeneity of deposits (5% on a 100mm substrate). This substrate holder is heated with RF polarization. The description of the services is described in the CCTP.. Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2025-12-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Rejuvenation Service for the Eremap Brand Magnetron Cathode Sputtering System
output.Description: This contract consists of renovating a sputtering frame for the deposition of thin layers under vacuum by magnetron cathode sputtering purchased by Aix-Marseille University in 2003. The equipment is composed of a chamber and its chassis as well as a control tower. All the power part, control and supervision is located in the control tower. The cooling range and all the sub-assemblies (deposit, pressure control, pumping, etc.) are integrated into the chassis chamber assembly. The primary pumps are independent. The chamber is equipped with 3 confocal sources and allows you to make co-deposits using these sources simultaneously. In addition, the rotation of the substrate holder ensures good homogeneity of deposits (5% on a 100mm substrate). This substrate holder is heated with RF polarization. The description of the services is described in the CCTP.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: BORDEAUX METROPOLE. Summary: Surveys and Polls on Behalf of Bordeaux Metropole. Description: The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. Each lot will be awarded separately. Services are regulated by unit prices. The services concern the carrying out of surveys, studies and surveys carried out by the holder on behalf of Bordeaux Metropolis. The objectives are multiple: - measure knowledge of the actions carried out by the community and analyze the image of Bordeaux Metropole (as an institution or as a territory), - understand the behaviors and habits of residents in their daily living environment, - evaluate the level of support of residents for the policies and projects of Bordeaux Metropole, - collect the expectations and needs of residents in relation to the skills of Bordeaux Metropole, - help in thinking about the communication tools and actions to be implemented and/or developed, - evaluate the communication actions undertaken and their impacts. This framework agreement sets all the conditions for execution of the services, it is executed progressively as purchase orders are issued by the contracting authority. The date of February 2 is given for information purposes only. The various survey and survey services are allocated as follows: - Lot 1: Quantitative surveys on behalf of Bordeaux Metropole - Lot 2: Qualitative surveys on behalf of Bordeaux Metropolis. Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2025-12-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF ORLEANS. Summary: Service Concession for the Development and Operation of Halles Chatelet in Orleans (45). Description: The purpose of this consultation, launched by the City of Orleans by concession contract, is to entrust the future concessionaire with the development and operation of the Halles Chatelet d'Orleans as well as the operation of the Halles de Transitions during the work period, and thus transfer a risk linked to the operation of the delegated service.<br> His remuneration will come for a substantial part from the operating revenues of the activities for which he will be responsible but also - where applicable - from financial contributions which will be paid to him by the Granting Authority and which will be defined within the draft contract.<br> The service concession is of a mixed type bringing together, on the one hand, activities relating to a public service (gourmet halls) (public service concession) and, on the other hand, activities which cannot be qualified as a public service (accessory activities restoration type). However, the geographical overlap and the need for overall coherence of the different activities developed in the draft contract requires the use of a single contract.<br> The concessionaire will be entirely responsible for the execution of its missions, both with regard to of Orleans as well as users and third parties.<br> The concessionaire will assume the operation of the works at its own expense and risk.<br> The main characteristics of the service and the work are presented in the draft contract and its annexes attached to this consultation file.<br> The procedure is .... Tender Value: 113000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COUNCIL OF EUROPE. Summary: Development of Local Studies on the Existing Mechanisms for Execution of the Ecthr Judgments in the Member States. Description: The multilateral Project "Support to efficient domestic capacity for the execution of ECtHR judgments (Phase 2)" aims to provide institutional support notably regarding the designation and the work of the coordinator of execution of judgments at the national level, both to steer the national execution process and maintain an effective dialogue with the CM. It builds on good practices developed in certain countries and support an enhanced dialogue among national coordinators.<br> During Phase 1 of the Project a Methodology was developed which constituted the basis for the development of the Multi-Country Study on domestic capacity for the execution of judgements and decisions of the European Court of Human Rights" which focused on the functional relevance of the existing mechanisms for execution of the ECtHR judgments in the member States in the light of the CM Recommendation (2008)2 and identifying good practices and effective national execution mechanisms.<br> The Multi-Country Study was based on local studies carried out with the support of academia and experts already studying the subject of implementation of the ECHR in the member States. The local studies were conducted for 27 CoE member States and they were based on the Methodology for a Study on the existing mechanisms for execution of the judgements and decisions of the European Court of the Human Rights in the member states in the light of CM Recommendation (2008)2".<br> This Phase 2 aims to update the Multi-Country Study by con.... Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-11-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF SAINT MARTIN (978). Summary: Environmental Assessment as Part of the Partial Revision of the Land Use Plan (Pos) of Saint-Martin. Description: The purpose of the contract is to carry out a **regulatory environmental assessment** as part of the **partial revision of the land use plan (POS)** of the Collectivity of Saint-Martin.<br> This mission aims to:<br> - Guarantee that environmental issues are taken into account throughout throughout the partial revision procedure of the POS, in accordance with European directive 2001/42/EC and articles L.122-1 et seq. of the Environmental Code,<br> - Provide an in-depth and detailed analysis of the environmental impacts of the partial revision of the POS,<br> - Propose measures avoidance, reduction and compensation (ERC) of identified impacts,<br> - Write and submit an environmental assessment report in compliance with regulatory requirements, for inclusion in the file submitted to the public inquiry scheduled for July 2026,<br> - Assist the Community in integration observations made by the Regional Environmental Authority Mission (MRAE) in the final report.<br> The contract is concluded for a period of 15 months from its notification, with an estimated amount of 350,000 euros excluding taxes, and provides for the delivery of deliverables in digital and paper format. according to the specifications of the consultation file.<br> Environmental assessment as part of the partial revision of the land use plan (POS) of Saint-Martin<br> SEE RC<br> Doc Title: Environmental assessment as part of the partial revision of the land use plan .... Tender Value: 350000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-27. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF COMMUNITIES CLUSES ARVE ET MONTAGNES. Summary: Administrative and Technical Management of the Travelers Reception Area and Family Land. Description: The purpose of this consultation is the administrative and technical management of the Travelers reception area and family land: - The administrative and technical management of the Travelers reception area, located in THYEZ (74300); - Administrative and technical management of the field family with 12 locations, located in CLUSES (74300). The management of the reception area and family land must be ensured taking into account priority areas for the 2CCAM: 1 - The obligation of means and responsiveness in terms of quality of services (intervention within a period of less than 1 hour) ; 2 - Compliance with regulatory provisions regarding parking, occupancy and use of equipment; 3 - Collection of fees, payment of fluids, damage costs, deposits/deposits for the reception area; 4 - Collection of rents for the family land; 5 - The obligation to dynamically maintain the state of the heritage of the reception area and the family land. This is an ordinary contract with a duration of 48 months (4 years) from 01/26/2026 until 01/25/2030. The contracting authority has decided not to launch the consultation in separate lots due to the fact that given the interweaving of the services requested, it would be technically difficult to foresee a devolution of the contract into separate lots. A visit to the site is possible according to the conditions provided for in the Regulations of the Consultation. Published Date: 2025-10-27. Closing Date: 2025-11-25. Competition: ICB. The services expected under the contract are detailed in the Technical Clauses Individuals (CCTP). This contract is a composite framework agreement with an ordinary market part concluded at a lump sum price and a purchase order framework agreement part concluded at a unit price. An on-site visit is mandatory. The offer of a candidate who has not made this visit will be declared irregular. Following the visit, a visit certificate will be issued by METPARK. The visit conditions are as follows: The visit to the sites is collective and takes place over 1 day, on one of the two following dates: - November 17, 2025 at 9:30 a.m. - November 18, 2025 at 9:30 a.m. The meeting place is: Parking Gambetta Rue Edmond Michelet, 33000 Bordeaux The car parks visited will be: Meriadeck, Victoire, Pey Berland, Saint Jean and Gambetta. In order to set the terms of visit, candidates are invited to contact METPARK in advance, through of the AWS platform via the correspondence tab", at the following address: https://www.marches-publics.info/.
